text: <@U02F8LF2X>: <@U02618EV1>  - coffee bot should probably stick to <#C0260V1C3> and not <#C02AXGXJQ>, otherwise <@U02918BKW> will blow a gasket
You're probably right.
"YOU GUYS - THERE ARE RULEZ" - ewald
It should stick to <#C0260V1C3> with an [at] channel handle.
We need to know...
<#C0260V1C3> + [at]channel = <#C02AXGXJQ>
Same effect.
:wink: yup
Oh, slow kid in the classroom.

Or we should have a coffee channel [at] channel notification. In my mind it's a relatively time sensitive notification. If others are going to find it annoying we should at least get one channel set up with it.
that makes sense... coffee drinkers join channel to be notified
I agree with you Trent. That's a good use of a channel.
or people can just add "coffee" as a highlight word in general
so that those who want to receive notifications for it can, and we don't have to bother everyone with an [at]channel announcement
I imagine it being easier just to keep a channel notification on <#C03ARAHN3>.
ugh, so many channels
I like Melissa's idea. does slack have a notion of creating custom groups? like an @coffee group that we could opt to join?
i guess it's essentially the same as what melissa's suggesting...
i think its just a highlight thing
there has to be a smart way to do this
we could use @coffee or #coffee as the highlight word, instead of just coffee... if we're automating a post anyway we can set what the post says
Well, I'm not going to argue. As long as I know when fresh coffee is done, I'll be happy.
i like adding @coffee (or whatever) as a highlight word if we want it
i think you can use @ but not # in highlight words
test @coffee
yep
But that wouldn't send a notification, right?

attachments.title: Chipotle's Much-Hyped Free Burrito Promotion Is Happening Today
attachments.text: In an effort to heat up customers' appetites for Sofritas, the burrito chain is offering a free entrée of any kind if you buy the organic tofu topping today.

text: <@U02618EV1> it sends a notification if you add it to your list of highlight words and make sure your preferences notify you of your highlight words

<http://www.finewoodworking.com/item/116508/3-d-printers-can-now-print-wood>

attachments.title: 3-D printers can now print wood - Fine Woodworking
attachments.text: New wood/plastic composites let 3-D printers print objects that look like wood, let's say wood-ish, including a grain pattern of sorts. One startup company is printing entire furniture pieces in one shot.
attachments.fallback: FineWoodworking.com: 3-D printers can now print wood - Fine Woodworking

text: "laywood" is the/one brand of wood filament. if you want to get really fancy you can change the temperature of the extruder head and print lighter and dark streaks to simulate grain
